alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:30PM CDT until April 20 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MARSHALL...CENTRAL WOODFORD AND NORTHEASTERN TAZEWELL COUNTIES... At 529 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Minonk to near Washington, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Minonk, Toluca, Secor and El Paso. This includes Interstate 39 between mile markers 16 and 35. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. These storms are producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
